report_title: Clay Brick and Product Manufacturing Industry Report
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Clay brick and product manufacturers produce clay bricks, ceramic tiles and refractory products principally used by the construction and manufacturing sectors. Over the past five years, clay producers have faced a major challenge from the pandemic, when declining consumer spending has reduced nonresidential construction and manufacturing output. Demand from residential markets was still strong, as low interest rates and government subsidization enabled lots of homebuying. As economic indicators improved during the post-pandemic recovery, revenue for the industry rose in tandem. However, rising interest rates in recent years have been causing spending on residential and nonresidential construction to plunge, reducing demand from two major downstream markets and causing revenue to tank. Recent trade wars have also disrupted the industry, as confrontation with China has reduced the import and export of clay products. Overall, revenue for clay brick and product manufacturers has lagged at a CAGR of 1.6% to $6.4 billion over the past five years, including a decline of 1.0% in 2024 alone. Clay and brick product manufacturers are expected to do much better during the outlook period but will still face a host of challenges. The US dollar is anticipated to depreciate, which will cause exports to surge, pushing revenue up. Economic growth is forecast to be steady, limiting declines in steel manufacturing demand and supporting spending on refractory products and nonresidential construction. In addition, these positive developments will contribute to residential construction growth. However, revenue for clay makers is projected to be threatened by growing competition from substitutes. Overall, clay brick and product manufacturing revenue is forecast to increase at a CAGR of 1.2% to $6.8 billion over the five years to 2029.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Trade wars have disrupted revenue streams for clay brick and product manufacturers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Trump administration initiated a trade war with China in the years leading up to the current period, resulting in China retaliating and increasing its tariffs. The effects of the trade war with China and poor international relations with other trading partners resulted in a decline in imports and exports in 2019, resulting in falling revenue during the same year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue for clay makers plunged during the pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Everyone was forced to stay home when lockdown measures were implemented amid the pandemic and many businesses were shuttered, so consumer spending tanked. In addition, limited household spending resulted in plunging revenue for manufacturers. Despite the malaise that the pandemic caused, clay brick and product manufacturers benefited from a jump in housing starts, as low interest rates and government support enabled consumers to buy new homes.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The recovery led to a partial resurgence for manufacturers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When businesses began opening up and social distancing measures were relaxed in 2021, consumers started spending in a host of markets again, causing revenue for clay brick and product manufacturers to partially recover from the pandemic slump.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising interest rates disturb demand throughout the construction sector
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Interest rates have been increasing throughout the latter part of the current period as the Federal Reserve attempts to tame inflation. Higher rates are increasing the cost of borrowing, severely inhibiting construction on residential and commercial projects. Since construction is the largest source of downstream demand for clay brick and product manufacturers, the poor performance of the construction sector has caused revenue for the industry to fall every year in the latter part of the current period, eliminating the gains displayed during the post-pandemic recovery.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Steady Economic Growth and Increased Demand for Nonresidential Construction Will Support Industry Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite current challenges related to inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, GDP growth is anticipated to be strong over the next five years. Strong economic growth will boost business sentiment and growth in nonresidential construction will contribute to limiting declines in steel manufacturing. Clay brick and product manufacturers get lots of business from commercial projects, so more nonresidential construction is expected to benefit the industry. Limited declines in demand for steel manufacturing will help contribute to the need for refractories, further boosting revenue for the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SURGING EXPORTS WILL LIKELY BE A BOON FOR CLAY MAKERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Exports have been negatively affected by recent trade wars, but the value of the US dollar is forecast to plunge during the outlook period. When the value of the US dollar is lower, consumers abroad view domestic goods as less expensive, so spending on industry products will surge. Clay brick and product manufacturers can sell worldwide more easily, boosting their revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE EXPANDING HOUSING MARKET PROVIDES MANUFACTURERS WITH AN OPPORTUNITY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Housing starts and home improvements are forecast to jump during the outlook period, despite further increases in the 30-year mortgage rate, making purchasing a home more expensive. The rate of population growth is also anticipated to rise, expanding demand for new homes since families are larger. In addition, spending on clay bricks and products from the residential market will push up. This will result in revenue growth, in line with rising exports.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: COMPETITION FROM SUBSTITUTES IS ANTICIPATED TO BE A THREAT TO THE INDUSTRY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Since clay bricks and products have many substitutes, revenue for the industry can be subject to major swings if consumers start to prefer them. More homeowners are expected to replace bricks with wood in their homes and use more glass instead of ceramic tiles for aesthetic designs. Corporations are anticipated to start preferring carpeting, hardwood and vinyl instead of ceramic tiles when designing their office space. Competition from these substitutes is expected to limit demand for clay bricks and products in residential and nonresidential construction.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry manufacture clay building materials, including bricks, mortars and ceramic tiles. Operators also manufacture clay and nonclay refractories, which retain their shape and chemical identity when subjected to high temperatures; these structures are ideal for use in kilns and furnaces. Significant industry buyers products include building markets, steel manufacturers and companies in the mineral refining sector.
key_trends: Start-up costs for clay brick and product manufacturers are fairly high since the industry is capital intense. Operators must purchase expensive plants, software, machines and skilled workers, so fewer individuals enter the industry, raising consolidation.
Most companies specialize, so they only make one type of clay product to be more efficient. Specialization helps to prevent monopolization in the industry.

Revenue for clay and brick product manufacturers has declined. Economic complications from the pandemic, rising interest rates and declining exports and imports from trade wars contributed to poor industry performance.

Performance for clay and brick product manufacturers will be positive over the next five years. Manufacturers are expected to benefit from surging exports resulting from a depreciating US dollar and will encounter a jump in industrial production, boosting revenue.

The largest clay and brick product manufacturer, Mohawk Industries Inc. (Mohawk), also operates in other industries such as Carpet Mills, Home Furnishing Wholesaling, Tile and Mobile Stores and Home Furnishing Wholesaling. Large companies such as Mohawk increase their significance by branching into many different sectors.

Major players have been engaging in mergers recently. Wienerberger AG just completed the purchase of the construction provider Meridian Brick, helping the operator expand its influence in clay and brick product manufacturing along with other industries.

Clay brick and product manufacturers are subject to a slew of different regulations. For example, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) determines how much particulate matter (PM) manufacturers can release to keep air pollution low.

The industry receives assistance from private organizations and the government. Organizations that help clay brick and product manufacturers are the Brick Industry Association (BIA), the Tile Council of North America (TCNA) and the Refractories Institute. Government assistance includes help from tariffs and recent pandemic-era aid.

Profit for clay brick and product manufacturers hasn't recovered since the pandemic. High interest rates have inhibited nonresidential and residential construction, damaging the industry's performance.

Wages for the industry are inelastic, as workers will become discouraged if their wages are cut. However, labor costs have declined more than revenue, so wages as a percentage of revenue have fallen over the past five years.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The residential construction market is the primary source of demand for clay bricks, ceramic floor tiles, wall tiles and terracotta roof tiles, especially in housing starts. Declines in housing starts hinder demand for industry products.
Demand from metal manufacturers is a significant market for clay products.
Clay products are used in various industrial applications beyond traditional construction.
Nonresidential construction is also a notable market for clay products.

products_and_services.product_description: Tiles made from clay for flooring and walls.
Materials that offer heat resistance but are not clay-based.
Other products within the industry not specified.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The residential construction market is the primary source of demand for clay bricks, ceramic floor tiles, wall tiles, and terracotta roof tiles, especially in housing starts.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The pandemic resulted in a significant decline in consumer spending, which reduced imports because demand for goods abroad plunged.
The conflict between Russia and Ukraine has resulted in European countries banning imports of oil from Russia, causing fuel costs to skyrocket.

international_trade_points.trade_title: US dollar rise impact on exports
international_trade_points.trade_description: Demand for American dollars has risen during the current period, which has caused the value of the US dollar to rise.
The recently passed United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) has enabled greater trade between the three North American countries.
